project.teaser: The quantity and quality of water resources are serious problems in many European areas, mostly being a joined result of climate change and anthropic influences. The BOOST-IN project aims to develop a successful strategy that promotes technological changes, governance schemes...
project.objective: The quantity and quality of water resources are serious problems in many European areas, mostly being a joined result of climate change and anthropic influences. The BOOST-IN project aims to develop a successful strategy that promotes technological changes, governance schemes, shifts in mind-set and organizational structures in order to solve these problems through a better management of the water sector and application of the circular economy principles, enabling water reuse and recovery of different materials (e.g. energy, nutrients). However, implementation of these changes still faces several barriers (e.g. technology, economy, knowledge, social perception) that need to be overcome. BOOST-IN will achieve these goals by an effective identification, selection (through a specifically designed dynamic funnel method) and transfer of innovative Water Circular Economy Solutions (WACES) to further close and improve the water cycle. The project will develop and apply its approach in six Regions of Opportunity evenly distributed across Europe (Spain, Greece, Germany, France, Italy and Bulgaria) by organization of co-creation workshops to increase public awareness and support for WACES implementation, barriers overcoming as well as by the specific risk management plans design. At the EU level the project will create an active network of stakeholders and set detailed action plans, including different training and education activities targeting water professionals. In order to promote and boost a successful market uptake of circular solutions and maximize the impact, the project will provide expertise on suitable business models and develop standardized quality criteria, as well as facilitate the links between solution providers and potential investors. Moreover, BOOST-IN will upgrade and benefit from the existing Water Europe Marketplace platform that will enable the projects clustering, B2B matchmaking and selections of appropriate WACES solutions for specific user needs.
project.title: Boosting the uptake of inovative solutions in the context of water and circular economy
project.keywords: Water reuse, secondary raw materials, citizen engagement, innovation uptake, goverance

article.title: Rising to the challenge of water management

result.title: First Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation plan of BOOST-IN project
result.description: Activities, responsibilities and timing of communication and dissemination, objectives and specific KPIs, and relevant key messages for different stakeholders as a result of the work under task 5.1.

result.title: First period clustering and networking report of BOOST-IN project
result.description: Report on lessons learned and major outputs of clustering and networking events where the consortium participated during the first project period under tasks 5.2 and 5.3.

result.title: Policy brief on social perception for water and circular economy solutions
result.description: One publication (policy brief) with professional layout of key project result: Social perception of CE in the water sector (WP2).

result.title: A novel methodology to develop EU water reuse risk management plan in agricultural water distribution networks and crop irrigation systems

details.authors: Pietro Drei, Giuseppe Mancuso, Stevo Lavrnić, Roberta Maffettone, Massimo Spizzirri, Luisa Merluzzi, Alessandra Mastrantonio, Paolo Burla, Attilio Toscano

result.title: Initial communication toolkit and website of BOOST-IN project
result.description: Results achieved regarding website, social media, visual identity, brochures, posters developed under task 5.1

result.title: Method and best-practice recommendations for co-creation of strategies to address social perception in the frame of water and circular economy
result.description: Method description for co-creation workshops with best practices and lessons learned performed in task 2.1

result.title: Experiences and lessons learned from End-of-Waste criteria of circular products
result.description: Existing experiences and lessons learnt from front-runner water utilities, technology providers and value chain managers on existing challenges and criteria to achieve EoW gathered under task 3.4

result.title: Gender and Ethics Action Plan of BOOST-IN project
result.description: Action plan to ensure proper handling of gender and ethics issues developed under task 7.4

result.title: Market and competitive landscape analysis of selected Water and Circular Economy Solutions
result.description: Analysis of market context for 10-15 selected WACES to support business development including market trends, regulations, barriers and drivers to market entry, etc. identified in task 4.1.

result.title: Policy assessment framework for Water and Circular Economy Solutions
result.description: Method for assessing regional/EU policy context of WACES innovations developed under task 3.1.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
